conclusion: Equation relating velocity squared to displacement for uniformly accelerated motion is v^2 = u^2 + 2ax.
Since both cars start from the same position and from rest, the equation simplifies to v^2 = 2ax.
Graph shows v^2 on the y-axis and x on the x-axis.
According to v^2 = 2ax, the slope of the line in the graph represents 2a.
Car A has a steeper slope than Car B.
A steeper slope indicates a larger value of 2a.
Since the slope is 2a, a steeper slope means a larger acceleration.
Car A, having the steeper slope, has a greater acceleration than Car B.
Final answer: Car A has the greater acceleration.
